title: DNS CDNs and other network
extract: A recursive DNS server is either operated by ISPs (Internet Service Providers) or provided as a public service for any users around the globe (e.g., the Google DNS service hosted at 8.8.8.8 and 8.8.4.4). ... Currently, it is common practice to outsource the task of content delivery a CDN provider.
extract_html: A recursive DNS server is either operated by ISPs (Internet Service Providers) or provided as a public service for any users around the globe (e.g., the Google DNS service hosted at 8.8.8.8 and 8.8.4.4). ... Currently, it is common practice to outsource the task of content delivery a CDN provider.
